entry.title: Fash autonomous firmware 2602
entry.summary: set IP_ADDR 10.0.0.5 set NETMASK 255.255.255.0 #ENABLE_BREAK=YES #format flash: tftp_init ether_init flash_init tar -xtract tftp://10.0.0.2/ap3g2-k9w7-tar.default flash: set BOOT flash:/ap3g2-k9w7-mx.153-3.JF15/ap3g2-k9w7-mx.153-3.JF15 load boot

entry.title: how to erase aironet conf
entry.summary: commande: wr erase debug capwap console cli erase /all nvram: undebug all reload
entry.content:
commande:

wr erase

debug capwap console cli

erase /all nvram:

 

undebug all

reload

entry.title: reset password
entry.summary: Password Recovery Procedure for the Cisco AIR-CAP2602I-E-K9 Jump to navigationJump to search Step 1: Hold the mode Button down for approximately 20 seconds while powering up the access point. The Indicator LED should end to be blinking in red Step 2: Issue the ether_init command: ap: ether_init Initializing…
entry.content:
Password Recovery Procedure for the Cisco AIR-CAP2602I-E-K9

 
 
Jump to navigationJump to search

Step 1: Hold the mode Button down for approximately 20 seconds while powering up the access point. The Indicator LED should end to be blinking in red

Step 2: Issue the ether_init command:

ap: ether_init
Initializing ethernet port 0...
Ethernet speed is 100 Mb - FULL Duplex

Step 3: Issue the flash_init command and the load_helper command:

If the Flash has already initialized, you see this:

ap: flash_init
Initializing Flash...
...The flash is already initialized.
ap:

If the Flash has not initialized, you see this:

ap: flash_init
Initializing Flash...
flashfs[0]: 21 files, 2 directories
flashfs[0]: 0 orphaned files, 0 orphaned directories
flashfs[0]: Total bytes: 7741440
flashfs[0]: Bytes used: 4499456
flashfs[0]: Bytes available: 3241984
flashfs[0]: flashfs fsck took 7 seconds.
...done initializing flash.
Boot Sector Filesystem (bs:) installed, fsid: 3
Parameter Block Filesystem (pb:) installed, fsid: 4

Issue the load_helper command in order to load any boot helper images. Here is an example:

   ap: load_helper
   ap:


Step 4: Issue the reset command followed by an y to approve the reset.

ap: reset
Are you sure you want to reset the system (y/n)?y
System resetting...

IOS Bootloader - Starting system.
flash is writable
FLASH CHIP:  Macronix Mirrorbit (00C2)
Xmodem file system is available. 

...

Step 5: Let the machine normally boot up this time. The default username and password after a reset should be Cisco[1]:

User Access Verification

Username: Cisco
Password: Cisco

APxxxx.xxxx.xxxx>

entry.title: How to reset Aironet admin password
entry.summary: Cisco switch by default have no password. To set a password or change previous password follow the instructions below: For Example: You are all done! Source: https://tutorialbit.com/networking/cisco-packet-tracer/set-or-change-password-of-cisco-switch-in-cisco-packet-tracer/
entry.content:
Cisco switch by default have no password. To set a password or change previous password follow the instructions below:

  1. Click on the Switch. A popup window will be opened.
  2. Go to CLI tab in the popup window.
  3. Click in command box.
  4. Press “Enter”.
  5. To enable the switch give give following command:
1
enable
  1. To enable configuration mode give following command:
1
configure terminal
  1. To change or set a password give following command:
1
enable password <PASSWORD>

For Example:

1
enable password Manik
  1. To save the configuration give following command:
1
do write memory
  1. To exit the configuration mode give following command:
1
exit
  1. To exit enable mode give following command:
1
exit

You are all done!

 

Source:  https://tutorialbit.com/networking/cisco-packet-tracer/set-or-change-password-of-cisco-switch-in-cisco-packet-tracer/

entry.title: Reset Cisco Aironet 2602i
entry.summary: Connect the console cable Unplug the power or network cable if connected to a POE switch Press and hold the Mode button Plug the power back into the AP Wait until the output on the console says button is pressed. Wait for button to be released… Once…
entry.content:
• Connect the console cable
  • Unplug the power or network cable if connected to a POE switch
  • Press and hold the Mode button
  • Plug the power back into the AP
  • Wait until the output on the console says button is pressed. Wait for button to be released…
  • Once that message is displayed release the button and allow the AP to boot

entry.title: Config Cisco Aironet Cisco Aironet 1602/2602/3602 2 SSID
entry.summary: Je fais ce post pour classer cette config d'AP cisco voici la source initiale ! logging rate-limit console 9 ! aaa new-model ! ! aaa authentication login default local aaa authorization exec default local ! aaa session-id common no ip routing no ip cef ip…
entry.content:
Je fais ce post pour classer cette config d'AP cisco

voici la source initiale

!
 logging rate-limit console 9
 !
 aaa new-model
 !
 !
 aaa authentication login default local
 aaa authorization exec default local
 !
 aaa session-id common
 no ip routing
 no ip cef
 ip domain name domain.corp
 !
 !
 !
 !
 dot11 syslog
 !
 dot11 ssid corp
 vlan 11
 authentication open
 authentication key-management wpa version 2
 mbssid guest-mode
 wpa-psk ascii Welcome1
 !
 dot11 ssid guest
 vlan 21
 authentication open
 authentication key-management wpa version 2
 guest-mode
 mbssid guest-mode
 wpa-psk ascii Welcome1
 !
 !
 dot11 guest
 !
 !
 !
 !
 !
 bridge irb
 !
 !
 !
 interface Dot11Radio0
 no ip address
 no ip route-cache
 !
 encryption vlan 11 mode ciphers aes-ccm tkip
 !
 encryption vlan 21 mode ciphers aes-ccm tkip
 !
 ssid corp
 !
 ssid guest
 !
 antenna gain 0
 mbssid
 station-role root
 !
 interface Dot11Radio0.11
 encapsulation dot1Q 11 native
 no ip route-cache
 bridge-group 1+
 bridge-group 1 subscriber-loop-control
 bridge-group 1 spanning-disabled
 bridge-group 1 block-unknown-source
 no bridge-group 1 source-learning
 no bridge-group 1 unicast-flooding
 !
 interface Dot11Radio0.21
 encapsulation dot1Q 21
 no ip route-cache
 bridge-group 21
 bridge-group 21 subscriber-loop-control
 bridge-group 21 spanning-disabled
 bridge-group 21 block-unknown-source
 no bridge-group 21 source-learning
 no bridge-group 21 unicast-flooding
 !
 interface Dot11Radio1
 no ip address
 no ip route-cache
 !
 encryption vlan 11 mode ciphers aes-ccm tkip
 !
 encryption vlan 21 mode ciphers aes-ccm tkip
 !
 ssid corp
 !
 ssid guest
 !
 antenna gain 0
 peakdetect
 dfs band 3 block
 stbc
 beamform ofdm
 mbssid
 channel dfs
 station-role root
 !
 interface Dot11Radio1.11
 encapsulation dot1Q 11 native
 no ip route-cache
 bridge-group 1
 bridge-group 1 subscriber-loop-control
 bridge-group 1 spanning-disabled
 bridge-group 1 block-unknown-source
 no bridge-group 1 source-learning
 no bridge-group 1 unicast-flooding
 !
 interface Dot11Radio1.21
 encapsulation dot1Q 21
 no ip route-cache
 bridge-group 21
 bridge-group 21 subscriber-loop-control
 bridge-group 21 spanning-disabled
 bridge-group 21 block-unknown-source
 no bridge-group 21 source-learning
 no bridge-group 21 unicast-flooding
 !
 interface GigabitEthernet0
 no ip address
 no ip route-cache
 duplex auto
 speed auto
 !
 interface GigabitEthernet0.11
 encapsulation dot1Q 11
 no ip route-cache
 bridge-group 1
 bridge-group 1 spanning-disabled
 no bridge-group 1 source-learning
 !
 interface GigabitEthernet0.21
 encapsulation dot1Q 21
 no ip route-cache
 no ip route-cache
 bridge-group 21
 no bridge-group 21 source-learning
 bridge-group 21 spanning-disabled
 !
 interface BVI1
 ip address 10.10.100.240 255.255.255.0
 no ip route-cache
 !
 ip default-gateway 10.10.100.250
 ip forward-protocol nd
 ip http server
 ip http authentication aaa
 no ip http secure-server
 ip http help-path http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/779/smbiz/prodconfig/help/eag
 !
 !
 !
 bridge 1 route ip
 !
 !
 !
 line con 0
 line vty 0 4
 transport input all
 !
 hostname company-location-wap01
 crypto key generate rsa modulus 2048
 end
